item.title: Emacs Shortcuts
item.description: Emacs Shortcuts Spc f d –> search for files in dired Spc : –> main command Spc g s –> git status Spc n n –> Capture template Spc n a –> agenda view Vim commands Ctrl up , down –> go up and down in file q [a-z] –> record a macro Shift » –> indent in code Evil snipe: s ch : go to ch ; same as f but more letters gc : to comment using evil gs [annotation] –> to go to lines directly like vimium ease dii –> delete inside indentation dik –> delete inside plus a line above Dired buffer shortcuts: Dired marking and unmarking options: % and * keys Narrow subtree : ( Show git status for files : ) Diff one file to another: = Create a directory : + Up a directory : - Rename a file: R Change timestamp of file: T Copy filename: Y Open a sub-directory in same menu: I Change ownership of file: O Unmark all files: U Hardlink of file: H Goto file: J Counsel search online: K Encrypt, decrypt a file: ; Uncompress or compress : Z Copy file to : C Byte compile a file: B Change file mode: M Copy async to rsync : C-c C-r Wide dired mode: i Org table by copying html table: C-c | Show all project TODOs: Spc p t Scroll other window : S-up Scroll other window down : S-down Backlinks Emacs Hugo Blogging

item.title: Emacs Tramp
item.description: Tramp mode for sshing Emacs Tramp tricks C-x C-f /ssh:root@ssb.willschenk.com:/etc/host This command will ssh into it and now projects can be browsed into emacs as if it were right here on my local machine. C-x C-f also need not be done since I have bound it to Spc-Spc. C-x C-f /sudo::/etc/hosts : edit file as sudo Also has some tips for docker

item.title: Emacs Hugo Blogging
item.description: ID: 0dacbf0d-550d-4db9-8e15-6ffcede1107c Hugo blogging <0d/acbf0d-550d-4db9-8e15-6ffcede1107c/_20200426_045146screenshot.png> Liked themes: Meme theme Harbor Cortex –JethroKuan Hello friend ng rhazdon Beautiful Hugo Blogging org mode Font Font: Source Code Pro : big size : Looks amazing: Is in google fonts as well //fonts.googleapis.com/css?family=Roboto+Slab:700,300,400|Source+Code+Pro:500 //maxcdn.bootstrapcdn.com/font-awesome/4.3.0/css/font-awesome.min.css Normalize css : I don’t know what it does but looks pretty cool with all these stars on github. I think I have a faint idea now about what it does.

item.title: Emacs Windows Installation
item.description: Problems with installing Not having msys2 so that pdftools can’t build [install msys] Not having mingw so that sqlite can’t build for org-roam [choco install mingw] Don’t even have to do that. The mingw is installed by msys2. So go to mysys2: there will be folder named mingw64. Add it’s bin to the PATH. pacman -Syu pacman -S base-devel pacman -S mingw-w64-x86_64-toolchain pacman -S mingw-w64-x86_64-zlib pacman -S mingw-w64-x86_64-libpng pacman -S mingw-w64-x86_64-poppler pacman -S mingw-w64-x86_64-imagemagick Then find a version that supports modules : emax64.

item.title: Emacs Completion
item.description: Vim’s omni like completion Keybind Description C-x C-] Complete etags C-x C-f Complete file path C-x C-k Complete from dictionary/keyword C-x C-l Complete full line C-x C-o Invoke complete-at-point function C-x C-n Complete next symbol at point C-x C-p Complete previous symbol at point C-x C-s Complete snippet C-x s Complete spelling suggestions

item.title: Emacs Hugo Blogging
item.description: :ID: 0dacbf0d-550d-4db9-8e15-6ffcede1107c Hugo blogging Liked themes: Meme theme Harbor Cortex –JethroKuan Hello friend ng rhazdon Beautiful Hugo Blogging org mode Font Font: Source Code Pro : big size : Looks amazing: Is in google fonts as well //fonts.googleapis.com/css?family=Roboto+Slab:700,300,400|Source+Code+Pro:500 //maxcdn.bootstrapcdn.com/font-awesome/4.3.0/css/font-awesome.min.css Normalize css : I don’t know what it does but looks pretty cool with all these stars on github. I think I have a faint idea now about what it does. It actually makes sure all line heights and stuffs look all the same whatever the browser may be.

item.description: Tramp mode for sshing Emacs Tramp tricks C-x C-f /ssh:root@ssb.willschenk.com:/etc/host This command will ssh into it and now projects can be browsed into emacs as if it were right here on my local machine. C-x C-f also need not be done since I have bound it to Spc-Spc. C-x C-f /sudo::/etc/hosts : edit file as sudo Also has some tips for docker

item.title: LISP
item.description: Major points to remember LET doesn’t let you refer to previous variables, so you need to use LET* for that. (progn do_this do_that) –> multiple things to do setting variables: (setq var-name value) Live Demo (write-line “single quote used, it inhibits evaluation”) (write ‘(* 2 3)) (write-line " “) (write-line “single quote not used, so expression evaluated”) (write (* 2 3)) require ’elm –> way of loading a library (1 2 3 4) acts as if 1 is a function here so for a list we say ‘(1 2 3 4) so it acts as a literal rather than function and it’s arguments.
